attributes.action: Pressure NICE to sort out the funding for Bisphosphonates for breast cancer.
attributes.background: Thousands of women are potentially missing out on taking these inexpensive drugs because of the lack of national guidance on who should fund them. It is not clear whether the hospital trust, the local clinical commissioning group (CCG) or NHS England central funding should be paying for them.

attributes.action: Bring back a discounted fee for regular users of the dartford crossing! DART-TAG
attributes.background: The discounted price of £1.67 is not good enough! As an everyday user I now pay roughly £1219.10 a year in crossings, living 10 mins away in erith! Whereas a few roads away in dartford people have the option to pay a £20 yearly fee! This is appalling - there's needs to be support for everyday users.
attributes.additional_details:
The previous dat tag gave the option of discounted prices, not only for local residents but commuters and regular users.

There is no support for those crossing everyday, they are instead paying out Thousands a year, when those locally have the option of a £20 annual fee.

The payments should have been scrapped once the cost of building was settled.

The Dartford Crossing is raking in £3MILLION per week in fines alone as people can not afford this upkeep on top of their cost of living!

attributes.action: Introduce a mandatory one month driving ban, for mobile phone use whilst driving
attributes.background: The Governments latest proposals, to crack down on mobile phone use whilst driving simply do not go far enough in my honest opinion and I say this not as someone whose life has been affected by this issue, rather that I hope that my friends or myself never will be !
attributes.additional_details:
From the window of my home I have an ideal vantage point to observe traffic as it comes to a halt at a nearby junction and, from the amount of people that I observe using their mobile phones, whilst they are driving it's very clear that the message is simply not getting across !

The introduction of a mandatory one month driving ban, for a first offence in addition to the proposed penalties would in my opinion be a more effective deterrent than what is currently on the table !

attributes.action: Scrap HS2, and build the best internet system in the world instead.
attributes.background: HS2 makes no difference to the vast majority and solves old world issues. The disruption over a long period make the cost uncertain, with little benefit to the vast majority of the public and industry. Let's build the very best internet instead and make the UK the worlds leading tech nation instead!
attributes.additional_details:
Fixing overcrowded railways will turn out way same as fixing overcrowded motorways, the more you build the more crowded they become. With driverless cars around the corner, let's jump a stage ahead and move commercial traffic to the railway system and focus on making commercial communication better with the best internet the world has seen so far.
We and the next wave of innovators would all benefit from the side effect of hyper fast and super efficient internet in ways not even thought of yet.

attributes.action: To make it more financially beneficial to work than it is to claim benefits!
attributes.background:
Being on benefits is easy! I believe it should be  made hard, and the more you work, the better rewarded you are! 

As a single parent, I want to work, have a better life and be a good role model. But the more I work, the less I have! It's so wrong!

attributes.action: Hold a parliamentary debate on the re-introduction of selective State Education
attributes.background: The Government has announced the return of selection in Secondary Education in England without any manifesto commitment or mandate to do so and 40 years after it was abolished as socially divisive and intrinsically unfair to the economically less advantaged.
attributes.additional_details: The Prime Minister argues that the re-introduction of grammar schools will enhance social mobility. However the evidence on the ground in those few areas where selective education remains entrenched is that though it may do so for the lucky few, many more are left behind. Selection favours affluent families who pay for the extra coaching to pass the selection tests and obstructs access for the poorest.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of kittens and puppies in pet shops
attributes.background: It is devastating to see that there are so many stray dogs and cats on the streets these days. Many are due to the fact that people go to pet stores, see an adorable little baby kitten or puppy and buy it on whim then further on down the line become bored and they end up in shelters up for adoption.
attributes.additional_details:
We can prevent this drastically if pet shops stop selling puppies and kittens. It will force people to go to the shelter and adopt an animal from there or make them think about it instead of buying them on impulse. Some pet shops won't vet the home it is going to, to make sure it's going to the best home possible.
We ask for urgent action to raise awareness & encourage the public to choose a responsibly bred puppy/kitten with history information, or adopt from a legitimate rescue organisation.

attributes.action: Put a limit on when HGV's and Tractors can access Main Roads and Motorways
attributes.background: During "rush hour" periods 0700-0900 and 1700-1900, HGV's and Tractors should not be allowed on Main Roads or Motorways due to the fact that they make every journey longer.
attributes.additional_details:
A large number of collisions and spillages on roads especially Motorways involve a HGV during busy periods, This leads to severe delays and road closures impacting the remaining 99% of road travellers time at home. 
By limiting the times to which they can travel the rush hour periods should run more smoothly allowing traffic to flow with less accidents

attributes.action: Up the fine for driving using a mobile to six points off license and £500.
attributes.background: Everyday I see dozens of drivers flouting this law and families are wrecked as a result. The present penalties are woefully inadequate and provide very little deterrent.

attributes.action: Scrap the 7 day week NHS proposals or fund them by the amount the BMA requires.
attributes.background: The "7 day week" proposals would stretch the already stretched resources and people of the NHS well past breaking point, and do Not provide the funding and staff required. The petition to have Mr Hunt removed was brushed aside, can we at least agree his policies need removing?
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence is in the proposals themselves and the medical practitioner's need to strike over such an unreasonable contract. No further evidence of inadequate provision is required, the burden of proof lies with those trying to push through the contract.
The BMA are the organisation representing the NHS and it's staff.

attributes.action: Stop doctors striking and withdrawing emergency care
attributes.background: We ask that the government make it illegal for people who work within the medical profession to withdraw from work and strike for more than 24 hours consecutively.   We also request that anyone doing so be struck off for intentionally causing distress and refusing to treat patients

attributes.action: Introduce banking skills to the secondary curriculum.
attributes.background: I believe that it is important that the use of banking services be a mandatory part of the secondary school curriculum as it would appear, from anecdotal reports and observation that many teenagers simply do not understand how to use basic banking services.

attributes.action: Except for MP salary. 100% tax on all other incomes for UK politicians.
attributes.background: Put 100% tax on all external to post income for all UK politicians including offshore investments and holdings. Prevent income and/or wealth transfers for a year prior to position. Ban a time offset for potential missed outside earnings. Ban employment post role in associated industry for 5 years.
attributes.additional_details:
Except for MP salary. Put 100% tax on all income for all UK politicians including offshore investments and holdings. 

To discourage people from becoming MPs for financial gain.

To encourage future MPs to consider their country the primary reason for taking a political post.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to exclude Legal Expenses cover against Financial Institutions
attributes.background: Family legal expenses policies commonly sold by insurance companies as an add on for about £30 specifically exclude taking any legal action against any insurance company or bank for any insurance contract, savings, pension or investment policy. This should be outlawed as an unfair contract condition
attributes.additional_details: The insurance industry has created a self protection society to the consumer's detriment. The Government has heavily criticised the FCA and the Ombudsman they created and often reach a decisions different to the law. The consumer is at their mercy as without legal expenses cover they can't afford to take action against arrogant, big boy bully insurance providers who just tell the consumer to go away. These policies are consequently worthless in this regard one of the biggest industries in the UK

attributes.action: Cut off all ties with Iran and cancel our part in the terrible deal immediately
attributes.background: The deal is a bad one, as everyone knows. It allows Iran to obtain nuclear weapons and missiles even quicker, thus endangering the security of Israel and the rest of the world. We want an end to this shameful and dangerous mistake at once.
attributes.additional_details: Obama lied about the deal as everyone knows.His clueless foreign policy is just to gain him anything of a legacy but he clearly understands nothing about the roots of terror and cares nothing about Israel's security. But our government should know better than to always bow to Obama. Phillip Hammond made a fool out of himself by trying to deny Iran wants to destroy Israel. Tony Blair and Gordon Brown would never have signed this deal and the Tories dare to claim they are more pro-Israel than them

attributes.action: make naloxone available to all opiate / opioid users in the uk.
attributes.background: I myself have almost lost my life to opiate overdoses and I have lost friends to opiate overdoses. lets do our best to stop this. This drug has absolutely no effect on people without opiates / opioids in their system.
attributes.additional_details: Naloxone is a medication used to counter the effects of opioid overdose Specifically, naloxone is used in opioid overdoses to counteract life-threatening depression of the central nervous system and respiratory system, allowing an overdose victim to breathe normally. Naloxone only works if a person has opioids in their system; the medication has no effect if opioids are absent. Naloxone has no potential for abuse.  It is a temporary drug that wears off in 20-90 minutes. (harmreduction.org)

attributes.action: I want a ban on Guns Knives Machetes Swords and other dangerous items.
attributes.background: Guns Knives Machetes Swords are sold openly at Car Boots Sales. We are in a climate where an attack on civilians could happen at any time and in any area. Legislation should be put in place to prevent this practice from continuing.

attributes.action: Stop South Africans voting in UK when Brits can't vote in SA.
attributes.background:
A Brit living in South Africa with permanent residency is prevented from voting in South African elections. However, South Africans can move to the UK and after meeting the residency requirements can vote in all UK elections.
This is grossly unjust and needs to be stopped
attributes.additional_details:
Qualifying Commonwealth citizens can vote in all UK elections once they've been resident for the requisite period but in some Commonwealth countries like South Africa there is no reciprocal agreement. This is blatantly unfair and unjust and must be stopped.

Who can vote in a South African election?
http://www.elections.org.za/content/For-Voters/FAQ--Voter-registration/

Who can vote in a UK election?
http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/faq/voting-and-registration/who-is-eligible-to-vote-at-a-uk-general-election

Qualifying Commonwealth citizens: http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/__data/assets/electoral_commission_pdf_file/0009/79515/List-of-eligible-countries.pdf

attributes.action: Bypass BREXIT but work for EU reform to allow UK border immigration control
attributes.background: Parliament is a representative democracy but should urgently respond to the disquiet over immigration expressed in the referendum. The implications of BREXIT are potentially horrendous for both the UK and EU and it is critical not to terminate, but to reformulate our membership.
attributes.additional_details: The  Referendum, widely recognized to have flawed origins and severely compromised by misinformation, should be considered accordingly. There are now new opportunities first to renegotiate our relationship with the EU regarding border control, and then work to improve structures with democratic processes, openness and transparency at its heart.

attributes.action: Increase tax allowance to £14,976 per year so minimum wage pay no tax on income
attributes.background: We believe this would encourage people back into full time employment whilst reducing benefits claims to a degree. This action may influence our economy as there would be potential for more disposable income.

attributes.action: Create a standard VED for all vehicles (with a fixed motor/engine) in the UK.
attributes.background: With vehicle excise duty (VED) rising year after year due to emissions, this is unfair and discriminating to large vehicle owners and being detrimental to the haulage industry, especially when hybrid and electric vehicle are exempt from VED. While the road quality in the UK is in decline.
attributes.additional_details: When VED was first introduced 1920 it was original create to help maintain the road structure of the UK up to 1937, due to weight of the vehicle using it. After 1937 it was change to a general tax, then was changed to emissions from 2001. The problem with this is some hybrid/electric vehicle weigh more than fuel vehicles, due to their components (batteries). Creating a greater stress on the road surface then a fuel vehicle. My proposal is to charge £1 for every 10kg the vehicle weighs.

attributes.action: There shouldn't be a speed limit for the outside lane on a motorway.
attributes.background: There are too many slow drivers that use the outside lane on a motorway. This lane is to be used for driving fast in and not going up to 70 mph.

attributes.action: Make  sanitary products free for secondary school girls in United Kingdom
attributes.background: The cost of sanity products has gone up and this has put a strain on the already lean purse of most household . Think the sensible thing is to cushion the effect of government cuts social benefits and the rise of income tax

attributes.action: Legal Immigrants on different visas category  must get ILR
attributes.background: Those immigrants who lived in Great Britain legally for 10 years should get indefinite leave to remain without any question as long as they do not have criminal convictions
attributes.additional_details:
Tier 1 visa category
Tier 2 visa category

attributes.action: Make armed forces pay similar or inline with those in public services.
attributes.background: The fact that the armed forces personnel are away from families and loves ones and are only on or around £19000 p/a. This is with no overtime rates and to work unsociable hours and long periods of time away. Commitment bonuses are lessoning and and advance trade pay is non existent to better the job

attributes.action: Chemists should provide receipts of prices for all items prescribed by doctors.
attributes.background: and also give information on whether the items can be purchased over the counter. this could save both the customer and the NHS a significant   amount of money and would also show how fortunate we are to have our NHS and only be paying £8.40 per item for such high priced medication.
attributes.additional_details: I believe if people knew how much they cost the NHS each month with un needed repeat prescriptions and half finished courses of medicines, as well as knowing if the drugs available to buy cheaper  over the counter it would greatly change the attitude a lot of people have with regards to our NHS and how they can make a great financial  difference to it, freeing up  money to hire more staff, pay the staff they have a decent wage  and fund further research efforts.

attributes.action: Make the day we leave the EU a national holiday within the United Kingdom!
attributes.background: I believe the day the announcement is made stating that The United Kingdom has full left the EU we should have that date as a United Kingdom Bank Holiday and should be a day of reflection of how strong we are as a small country! 'National Brexit Day'!

attributes.action: Carbon tax products from countries reneging on their climate change commitments
attributes.background: UK taxpayers and businesses pay a considerable amount, though direct and indirect taxation, to help the country meet its climate change commitments.  However, some countries are making little effort to reduce carbon emissions, and some are reneging on agreed clime change commitments and treaties.

attributes.action: Tax footy transfers >£1m to fund NHS nurses & require firms to sponsor a nurse
attributes.background: All football transfer to be taxed at vat rate go towards NHS nurses funding in whole of uk. Any firm over a set size would be required to fund a nurses salary and uniform - any additional nurse funding by the same firm could be in part allowable against tax.

attributes.action: Reconstruct The Crystal Palace
attributes.background: The Crystal Palace was an impressive architectural feat with a design that was arguably ahead of its time.  This impressive piece of Victorian heritage was cruelly destroyed by fire in 1936, depriving too many from ever having seen it in all it's glory.  Please re-build this long lost treasure.
attributes.additional_details:
The Crystal Palace was first constructed in 1851 in Hyde Park for the Great Exhibition, which showcased new technology from the Industrial Revolution. It was moved to the Sydenham/Penge area in 1854 and opened by Queen Victoria.  

As an attraction the Crystal Palace showcased a wide variety of festivals and events.  Reconstructing the Palace would be a fantastic opportunity to reinvigorate the area as a cultural hub and return a part of our history that should never have been lost.

attributes.action: License all drone operators in the uk
attributes.background: Many drone owners operate their machines without training, are ignorant of the law and pose a danger to the well being and privacy of the general public. For those reasons they should be trained and licensed before flying these devices.

attributes.action: Make the Mersey Gateway Bridge free to all Public Transport and Halton Residents
attributes.background: We have been told by George Osborne and David Cameron that we will have all inclusive travel via the Silver Jubilee bridge and the Mersey Gateway Bridge that  free of charge and not based on yearly admin fees which can be viewed as a subscription.
attributes.additional_details:
David Cameron came to vist o2 in Runcorn in2015 and he vouched the bridge would be free I heard this straight from the horses mouth and was also documented on North West Tonight.
link as follows from George Osbourne http://www.merseygateway.co.uk/2014/07/chancellor-of-the-exchequer-george-osborne-announces-free-trips-across-both-silver-jubilee-and-mersey-gateway-bridges-for-all-halton-residents/

attributes.action: Seek Closer Relations With Russia
attributes.background: Russia is a powerful nation, one that is under siege. We've all heard the countless things that Russia has done to show off it's armed forces, but can we blame them? The media heavily shows Russia as the bad guys but that's simply not true. The west are the ones at fault.
attributes.additional_details: Time and time again we provoke Russia and when we get a response our media instantly turns on it's propaganda machines and makes us look innocent. What good would it be to continue trade sanctions and threatening them with military action (Not directly - but through military drills). If we wish to have 'everlasting peace in our time' - then the solution is not to provoke a country into a state where it wishes to defend itself. Instead of such provocations we should seek diplomacy of co-operation

attributes.action: Ban the use of Body Mass Index (BMI) as a measure of obesity by NHS
attributes.background: Set in 1830 by a non-medical mathematician and astronomer, BMI is an inaccurate measure of body fat content and does not take into account muscle mass, bone density, overall body composition, racial and sex differences. When Johnny Wilkinson won the RWC he was officially overweight according to BMI.
attributes.additional_details: There is an urgent need for accurate tools to measure fat and skeletal muscle, and biomarkers that can better predict the risks of diseases and mortality. Advances to improve the measurement of obesity and related factors will help determine the optimal weight for an individual, taking into account factors such as age, sex, genetics, fitness, pre-existing diseases, as well as novel blood markers and metabolic parameters altered by obesity. (Ahima and Lazar, Science, August 2013)

attributes.action: Every UK pet owner/breeder/pet to be registered or £1000 fine given.
attributes.background: Reduce the number of reported/unreported animal abuse cases via strict registration laws. Owners would need to take their pet to a registration office within a week of getting the animal. Simple DNA sample to be taken from animal. Incentives for people who suspect an animal/owner is not registered.

attributes.action: Repeal the VED legislation Changes coming into force in April 2017
attributes.background: The proposed VED changes coming into force in April 2017 mean it is no longer an incentive to buy a low polluting car.
attributes.additional_details:
The new changes introduce the same basic charge on each subsequent year of ownership after the first year of ownership meaning if someone bought a 1 year old high polluting car they would pay the same tax as a 1 year old low polluting car removing the incentive to buy the economical car.

A much fairer system would be to move all of the band thresholds down so the emissions target for £0 VED is now 80g/km for example. And the 100g/km band now pays £30 a year and so on.

attributes.action: Change disabled parking signs to a D for disabled not a wheelchair
attributes.background: Disabled parking has a stigma attached you have to be in a wheel chair to use them but over 500000 people in the country how other disability where than don't need a wheel chair and are looked at as they should not park in the disabled  bays which is wrong

attributes.action: Stop DWP removing Motability cars before the Appeal Process is exhausted.
attributes.background: Motability car drivers are disadvantaged when PIP assessments mean they can no longer keep their cars.
attributes.additional_details:
Personal Independence Payment (PIP) assessment means disabled people are quite often assessed at the standard rate for mobility. This means they are no longer entitled to a Motability vehicle. The letter informing them of this gives them four weeks to return their cars. 

If their reconsideration and/or appeal is successful, they will have given up their cars for nothing. 

Please find a way to help these people keep their cars until a final appeal is unsuccessful.

attributes.action: Allow people to make voluntary contributions to the NHS
attributes.background:
By signing this petition you are asking MPs to debate the feasibility of allowing the public to make voluntary financial contributions to the NHS.
Voluntary contributions could help ease the strain on the health service and the people who work in it at a time when they face unprecedented pressure.
attributes.additional_details:
Allowing members of the public to make voluntary contributions to the NHS would provide people with the means to aid and potentially save an institution that has at some point in their lives helped them. 
By signing this petition you send a message of solidarity to the workers of the NHS, that you acknowledge that the difficulties the health service currently faces are not the result of their work ethos or competence but of the funding constraints that are placed upon them.

attributes.action: To stop the £1,000 immigration skills charge for workers outside the EU
attributes.background:
The Immigration Minister Robert Goodwill has suggested.
A £1,000 immigration "skills charge" is being brought in this April for firms recruiting workers from outside the EU. This means that when we leave the EU, the 3 million EU citizens, who live in this country may have to pay this too.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-38581873

attributes.action: Limit the amount private parking enforcement companies can charge.
attributes.background: Many carparks are monitored by private parking enforcement companies. It is logical to ensure people obey parking rules but they often apply massive fines of £100 for minor parking violations. For many people such high fines cause financial difficulties, this is too high  for minor infractions.
attributes.additional_details: It is of course right to ensure people use carparks fairly and obey the rules. However it is totally unfair that a charge of £100 can be applied for say an overstay of just a few minutes.  For sites where people pay to park I think the limit should be £50 or 5 times the amount of underpayment, whichever is the lower.

attributes.action: Amend the Children Act to allow courts the power to change birth certificates
attributes.background: The government should draft an amendment to the law to allow courts power under the Children Act 1989 to decide in exceptional circumstances if it is in the long term interests of the child to change the child's surname on the birth certificate to reflect a new surname ordered by the courts.
attributes.additional_details:
The law allows a facility for one parent to remove the wrong fathers details from the birth certificate and re-register the birth to include the natural fathers details.

A court can order that a child is to be known by a new surname, but has no power to decide whether that new surname should be reflected on the birth certificate. The other parent's permission is needed for such a change, if this is not gained the wrong father's surname will remain on the entry indefinitely requiring a deed poll.

attributes.action: Senior Ministers should be available to mainstream media during crises...
attributes.background:
With self-evident crises (like the NHS or Southern Rail) the Minister with that brief should be directly answerable. 
I have lost count of the number of times I've heard phrases like 'we asked for a comment but no one was available.'
attributes.additional_details:
Clearly we don't need to interrogate Ministers on their shoes or their trousers (leather or not) - this would be petty. 
When something serious is unfolding, however, they should be immediately available and answerable.
Some Ministers (eg Jeremy Hunt) seem to see their job as some kind of sinecure: not good enough. 
We don't need written statements - they can't be interrogated. Nor a junior sacrificial lamb (eg Chris Philp). We need the Minister with overall responsibility.

attributes.action: More funding to domestic violence charities and provide more shelter for victims
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students at Greenwood Academy in Birmingham. We believe not enough is done to support men and women who are victims of domestic violence. We want to see groups like Refuge get more funding to shelter victims and offer financial support to relocate them.

attributes.action: Enforce deadlines upon car insurance companies for the completion of claims
attributes.background: A person involved in an accident & not at fault, can wait months if the other side ignore their insurance company and don't respond, due to their being no deadline on a response from the other party. Insurance should have 28 days to investigate blame & escalate to a dispute process if no agreement

attributes.action: Drivers of motor vehicles to use headlights at all times of the day and night.
attributes.background: Vehicles are often driven in poor light conditions. Vehicle colourings can make them nearly invisible against background colours. In daylight they can also be difficult to see. Compulsory headlights would make vehicles more visible and improve road safety. A no cost issue to motorists. A WIN WIN.

attributes.action: Reduce or abolish university fees
attributes.background: The rising fee of University fees is leaving many students in massive debt or maybe even putting off the chance to attend higher education. this then leaves unbalance of social class such as the more well off students are attending whereas the less well off aren't able to.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory in England for Air Gun Licensing.
attributes.background: I think it should be made compulsory to stop people going in public places, ie woods and shooting anything that moves.
attributes.additional_details: I have been out with my dog and experienced a youth pointing a gun at my dog. As a license holder myself i believe that any gun, ie air pistol or air rifle you should have to hold a license for as you do with any other gun to stop these type of guns falling into the wrong hands.

attributes.action: Urgent review of Royal Navy capabilities, with immediate action on results.
attributes.background:
The Harrier Jet was scrapped by the UK in 2010, (USA will scrap them in 2025). Our last Aircraft Carrier was scrapped in 2016.
The replacement will enter service possibly in 2020.
I want our Government to immediately find a solution to this massive capability gap and implement it without delay.
attributes.additional_details:
The Harrier Jump Jet was scrapped in 2010 (USA will scrap them in 2025).  Our last Aircraft Carrier was scrapped in 2016.
No replacement has yet entered service. The MOD accountants have left this once great Maritime Nation defenceless. Utter madness to dispose of essential defence equipment before the replacement has been thoroughly trialled and allowed to enter service.
I want our Government to immediately find a solution to this massive capability gap and implement it without delay.

attributes.action: Glaucoma  patients who need their eye pressure  checked should not be charged.
attributes.background: At present Glaucoma patients can only have their eye pressure tests done once a year covered at NHS cost, if there is a need to monitor the eye pressure to prevent going blind
